System Commands:

from man systemctl. TAB completion can be work after sudo su.

commandcommit
is-system-runningCheck whether system is fully running
defaultEnter system default mode
rescueEnter system rescue mode
emergencyEnter system emergency mode
haltShut down and halt the system
*poweroffShut down and power-off the system
reboot [ARG]Shut down and reboot the system
kexecShut down and reboot the system with kexec
exit [EXIT_CODE]Request user instance or container exit
switch-root ROOT [INIT]Change to a different root file system
*suspendSuspend the system
*hibernateHibernate the system
*hybrid-sleepHibernate and suspend the system

entry.title: å¦‚ä½•æœ‰æ•ˆçš„ç»„ç»‡é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶
entry.content:
A:åœ¨å®¶ç›®å½•ä¸‹ï¼Œæœ‰å¾ˆå¤šéšè—æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œæ•£å¸ƒåˆ†å¸ƒçš„ã€‚å…¶ä¸­ä¸€äº›æ˜¯éå¸¸é‡è¦çš„é…ç½®æ–‡ä»¶ï¼Œé€šå¸¸æˆ‘ä»¬éœ€è¦å¯¹è¿™äº›æ–‡ä»¶ä½œå¤‡ä»½å’Œç‰ˆæœ¬æ§åˆ¶ã€‚æ€æ ·æ‰èƒ½åšåˆ°å‘¢ï¼Ÿ

A:In the home directory, there are a lot of hidden files, scattered distribution. Some of them are very important configuration files, and we usually need to make backup and version control for these files. How can we do that?

#How to effectively organize/manage your personal profile.

Due to git can not handle symlinks, Iâ€™ve always organized my profiles like this:

softlink files/directories in ~source files/directories in git repo
~/.local/share/applications->$git/config/.local+share+applications
~/.local/share/nautilus/scripts->$git/config/.local+share+nautilus+scripts
~/.vimrc->$git/config/.vimrc
~/.proxy.pac->$git/config/.proxy.pac
~/.bash_aliases->$git/config/.bash_aliases
~/.icons->$git/config/.icons/
~/.vim->$git/config/.vim
~/.gitconfig->$git/config/.gitconfig

##Step:

  1. Move all important personal config files in your /home/xxx to $git/config;
  2. Make softlink from config directory to ~ directory, using a script named â€˜link-all-hidden-files-to-home.bashâ€™, This script is also in the same directory $git/config;
  3. Do git commit and push in git repository;

##Benefit:

  1. All of your configuration at a glance.
  2. When you need to edit, it is convenient.
  3. Can use git for version control.
  4. Synchronize between different machines.

##link-all-hidden-files-to-home.bash:

it will replace all â€˜+â€™ in filename to â€˜/â€˜. eg, file â€œ.local+share+applicationsâ€ would be extended as â€œ.local/share/applicationsâ€:

##You can find out all those symlinks like this:

entry.title: è®¾ç½®æ–°çš„mimetypeå’Œå›¾æ ‡
entry.content:
Create New Mimetype

Add Icon to mimetype.

  1. found mimetype name, eg application/x-extension-fcstd:

    â–¶ mimetype .fcstd.fcstd: application/x-extension-fcstd

  2. found a suitable svg file and cp to here /usr/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/mimetype, and the file name must be application-x-extension-fcstd which just like the mimetype name:

    â–¶ sudo cp ~/FreeCAD-logo.svg /usr/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/mimetypes/application-x-extension-fcstd.svgâ–¶ sudo cp ~/Dolphin_triangle_mesh.svg /usr/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/mimetypes/application-x-STereoLithography.svg

  1. update icon cache with -f, (here has the index.theme file):

    â–¶ sudo gtk-update-icon-cache /usr/share/icons/hicolor/ -f

  2. nautilus change file icon immediately.

pushed A out already. In such a case, and only if you are certain that nobody in
the meantime fetched your earlier commit A (and started building on top of it),
you can run â€œgit push â€“forceâ€ to overwrite it. In other words, â€œgit push
â€“forceâ€ is a method reserved for a case where you do mean to lose history.

#!/usr/bin/perl -w

use utf8;
use strict;
use WWW::Mechanize;
use Net::DBus;

my $dir=â€$ENV{HOME}/flv-downloadâ€;
-d $dir && chdir $dir;

$=$ARGV[0];
s/^http:/([a-z0-9])/http://$1/;
chomp; s///%2F/g; s/:/%3A/g;
$=â€http://www.flvcd.com/parse.php?flag=&format=&kw=$_&sbt=%BF%AA%CA%BCGO%21";

my $bus = Net::DBus->session->get_service(â€œorg.freedesktop.Notificationsâ€)->get_object(â€œ/org/freedesktop/Notificationsâ€,â€org.freedesktop.Notificationsâ€);
my $mech = WWW::Mechanize->new();
$mech -> get($);
if ($mech->success()) {
$=$mech->content();
if(/å½“å‰è§£æè§†é¢‘./){
$_=$&; s/^.?strong>//; s/<strong.//;
print â€œ\e[31m\e[1mâ€.$_.â€\e[0m================== â€;
s/ .//;
mkdir â€œ$â€œ; chdir â€œ$â€œ;
my $name=â€$_â€;
my @link=$mech->find_all_links(text_regex => qr/http://.[0-9a-fA-F]/,);
my $size=@link;
$bus->Notify(â€œflashâ€, 0, â€œsunnyâ€, â€œ$nameâ€, â€œå…±è·å– $size ä¸ªåœ°å€ã€‚â€, [], { }, -1);
xtermcontrol --title "flash-down.pl_ä¸‹è½½_$name";
print map â€œ=> \e[32mâ€.$->url().â€\e[0m â€,@link;
open(LINK,â€>link.logâ€); print LINK map $->url().â€ â€,@link; close LINK;
my $cnt=1; my $proc=â€â–­â€x$size;
foreach(@link){
my $add=$->url();
print â€œ\e[31mä¸‹è½½\e[0m => \e[32m$add\e[0m â€;
my $file=sprintf â€œ%02d.flvâ€,$cnt;
wget -c --user-agent="Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.0.3) Gecko/2008092416 Firefox/3.0.3" $add -O $file 2>/dev/null;
$=$?==0?â€â– â€:â€â–¡â€;$proc=~s/â–­/$_/;

$bus->Notify(â€œflashâ€, 0, ($?==0?â€sunnyâ€:â€errorâ€), â€œ$nameâ€, â€œå·²ç»å®Œæˆä¸‹è½½ $cnt / $size ï¼Œwgetè¿”å›ï¼š$? ã€‚ è¿›åº¦ï¼š$procâ€, [], { }, -1);

    print "\e[31m\e[1m$name å·²ç»å®Œæˆä¸‹è½½ $cnt / $size\e[0m ï¼Œwgetè¿”å›ï¼š$? ã€‚è¿›åº¦ï¼š\e[31m\e[1m$proc\e[0m
";    $cnt++;}chdir "..";`echo "$ARGV[0]	ã€Š$_ã€‹ å·²ç»æ‰§è¡Œä¸‹è½½ã€‚ç»“æœï¼š$proc">>flash-down.log`;`aplay "/home/exp/åª’ä½“/äº‹ä»¶å£°éŸ³-et/I-need-ammo.wav"`;} else {/æç¤ºï¼š.*/; $_=$&; s/<br/>.*$//; $bus->Notify("flash", 0, "error", "flash è§£æå¤±è´¥", "$_
:(", [], { }, -1);}

} else {
$bus->Notify(â€œflashâ€, 0, â€œgtk-cancelâ€, â€œç½‘é¡µæ— æ•ˆâ€, â€œ:(â€œ, [], { }, -1);
}

#!/usr/bin/perl -w

use utf8;

my $bus = Net::DBus->session->get_service(â€œorg.freedesktop.Notificationsâ€)
->get_object(â€œ/org/freedesktop/Notificationsâ€,â€org.freedesktop.Notificationsâ€);
my $mech = WWW::Mechanize->new();
my $web_select=â€imagebinâ€; #é€‰æ‹©è´´å›¾ç½‘ç«™çš„ç¼©å†™çŸ­è¯­ï¼Œä¼šåœ¨åˆ—è¡¨ä¸­è‡ªåŠ¨åŒ¹é…çš„
my $add;

#======================
my %web=( â€œhttp://www.cjb.net/â€œ=>{â€œimageâ€=>$ARGV[0]},
â€œhttp://kimag.es/â€œ=>{â€œuserfile1â€=>$ARGV[0]},
â€œhttp://imagebin.org/index.php?page=addâ€œ=>{â€œnicknameâ€=>â€eexpâ€,â€imageâ€ => $ARGV[0],â€disclaimer_agreeâ€=>â€Yâ€},
â€œhttp://paste.ubuntu.org.cn/â€œ=>{â€œposterâ€=>â€eexpâ€,â€screenshotâ€=>$ARGV[0],â€code2â€=>join(â€œ â€,xsel -o)},
â€œhttp://tinypic.com/â€œ=>{â€œthe_fileâ€=>$ARGV[0]}, #Error GETing http://tinypic.com/
);

if(!$add){$bus->Notify(â€œpaste-imgâ€, 0, â€œerrorâ€, â€œæ— æ•ˆç½‘ç«™åœ°å€â€, â€œ:(â€œ, [], { }, -1);exit;}
print $web_select.â€ â€;

#======================
$mech -> get($add);
$mech -> submit_form(with_fields => $web{$add});

#======================
if ($mech->success()) {
my $rr=$mech->uri();
print â€œè´´å›¾åœ°å€ï¼š $rr ã€‚ â€;
echo $rr|xsel -i;
$bus->Notify(â€œpaste-imgâ€, 0, â€œsunnyâ€, â€œè´´å›¾åœ°å€â€, $rr, [], { }, -1);
} else {
$bus->Notify(â€œpaste-imgâ€, 0, â€œerrorâ€, â€œè´´å›¾å¤±è´¥â€, â€œ:(â€œ, [], { }, -1);
print â€œERROR: â€.$mech->status().â€ â€;

37. The module does not LOAD at boot

CHECK the module is installed in the following directory:
/lib/modules/$KVERS/misc

Check hotplug is installed and that the kernel is configured to use it.
Check that the module dependencies are up to date. CHECK the file
/lib/modules/KVERS/modules.usbmap to see ig it contains references to
the eagle-usb.(o|ko) module.

CHECK you have a recent version of modutils.

38. The module is loaded at boot, bug hotplug do not load
the firmware or the DSP code

Hotplug should LOAD the DSP code thanks to the script
/etc/hotplug/usb/eagle-usb

It is called whenever the modem declares itself on the USB bus
with the USB identifiers that are specified in the file
/lib/modules/$KVERS/modules.usbmap,
just after the module was loaded.

CHECK these files are correct, and that have execute permission.
